On the big day we had exclusivity of the hotel for the rest of our guests to join. The bridal party got ready in the bridal suite which is beautiful and very spacious. The day went as planned with the hotel staff, especially Joanna and James, were excellent and kept everything in order on the day. Anything we asked was not a problem for them. The food was first class and the wedding room was stunning. We could not recommended this hotel enough. It really was the best day of our lives and we could not have done it without the help of all the staff at the hotel. The newly refurbished bedrooms and public areas are amazing and could not be faulted. All of our guests had the best time.


The Hotel is absolutely beautiful after refurb. Staff couldn't do enoight for us to make our

From our initial meeting at the venue to waving goodbye the day after our wedding I cannot fault Marshal Meadows Manor. The quality of food, choice, service and the venue for the price we paid was amazing. When we were looking for venues nowhere came close price wise. It‚Äôs a beautiful venue with a separate purpose built building for the ceremony with a sea view. The bridal suite is absolutely stunning. Our guests said that the wedding meal was the best they had had at a wedding and they loved the fact they got to choose their own courses (from 3 options per course). And lastly the kindness and professionalism of the staff can‚Äôt be beaten. We felt like it was a home from home. They were so warm and welcoming and helpful. I can‚Äôt recommend this venue more highly.

Our wedding at Marshall Meadows Manor House was everything we could have wished for. The venue was absolutely beautiful, we were blessed with amazing weather and the staff were so friendly and helpful throughout the whole day! We were also so impressed with the food and several guests commented on how delicious everything was.

Our guests were also super impressed with the rooms at Marshall Meadows, the bridal suite really is so impressive and perfect for the bride and bridesmaids to get ready together.

We even got to venture down to the nearby cliffs after the ceremony to get some amazing photos along the coastline of the border.

Couldn't recommend Marshall Meadows enough! Thank you so much for making our wedding so perfect.

This venue is an absolute gem, located with beautiful surroundings, right on the border and the coast with beautiful views. The building, inside and out is perfectly matched to its star rating and is all we wanted for our wedding. The staff are all willing to help with anything, and did everything they possibly could to ensure our big day went perfectly. If we had any queries, they were on hand to help.
All of our guests, and ourselves were extremely pleased with the way the day went, and loved every minute of it.
There is no way Marshall Meadows, or any of its staff can be faulted in any way. They take any stress and worry out of the organisation and take everything in hand to allow you to enjoy the day.
We love the place so much we will be going back, and our guests are looking forward to going back one day again.
And for the mojito and whiskey lovers out there - definitely a yes!!!!!

We knew after our first visit that Marshall Meadows was the venue for us.
The elegant style of the building and modern yet classic decor really stood out.
After dining here we couldn‚Äôt wait for the big day!
Picking the wedding breakfast was difficult as every dish we tried we loved.
The pizza van in the evening gave an amazing relaxed vibe and really complimented our chilled approach.
Michelle and Toyah were both fantastic and a credit to this venue.
Our day ran so smoothly and I thank them and all the staff for this.
We had the pleasure of staying for three nights, the stable suite, the bridal suite and the pods are amazing, the attention to detail is flawless.

I highly recommend this beautiful Manor House , working in the wedding industry I visit many venues in Scotland and we choose to hop the border to spend our special day here.

I was just married here in June and I cannot say enough good things about this venue or the people who truly make it shine. Over your stay here no matter how short you will immediately feel like you are a part of the family. David and Deb are so wonderfully kind, incredibly helpful, personable, and outstanding at what they do. We planned this wedding from across the pond and I didn't have to worry once about food (which was one of the best meals I had while abroad), any of the ceremony or reception sites or flowers, really they take care of so much for you it makes the day so smooth and easy! My wedding day was an absolute dream and fulfilled every LOTR elvish whim I could imagine. Again I cannot say enough good things about David and the staff at Branxholm no one went hungry and certainly not thirsty the whole weekend. All of this and the fact that there are horses, baby chicks, goats, incredible accommodations, and literally SO MUCH more makes Branxholm Park the PERFECT wedding venue. I booked site unseen, it even rained and I regret nothing.
Fantastic time at Darren & Eilidh Leslie wedding *, beautiful venue,lovely food and great staff*. Thanks for letting oscar feed the horses

Brothers wedding so my son and I stayed the weekend along with other family members. Cannot recommend this place enough. Food was brilliant, the rooms were brilliant. Staff were so friendly, one of them even let my wee boy feed the horses on the Saturday morning. He absolutely loved it. If you are looking for a place for a wedding then this is the place

We got married at Branxholm Park in September 2024. The venue is beautiful; a quirky, well-curated collection of indoor and outdoor spaces, ensuring nobody could ever get bored. The animals are a gorgeous inclusion - the goats and horses are so friendly, and there's a wonderfully affectionate 3-legged cat called Cookie who was the real star of our day!

We booked the venue unseen - just based on the website and video tours - as we live in South Wales so couldn't nip up to an open day. This definitely contributed to my anxiety leading up to the day, but David & Debbie assured us that lots of people book without visiting, and the house and grounds really did exceed expectations. We did gasp as we drove up the road and saw it for the first time. We were lucky to have gorgeous sunny weather and the most amazing group of guests and vendors, so despite anxieties and small oversights, it really was a perfect wedding.

The staff at the house were fantastic, making us feel so incredibly welcome from the moment we arrived. Nothing was too much trouble. A special mention to Becky and Tracey, who were just fabulous friendly faces and above-and-beyond helpful.

I would have to say, though, that the wedding would have been much easier if we'd been able to speak to Becky (the on-the-day coordinator) in advance. It would also have been nice to receive some sort of welcome pack or guide to wedding planning. All the planning is done through emails with Debbie (the owner) who was a little difficult to talk to - slow or non-existent replies, confusing typos, lack of detail, and would not provide things like a seating plan despite being asked repeatedly. Maybe she's just very relaxed because they have a template for wedding days, but as an anxious couple we could have done with better communication and some more support with finalising details of our day. Several things that Debbie agreed/assured us would happen were not communicated to Becky and the house staff - they immediately sorted things out after our arrival and a quick chat, but it was unfair that they weren't warned about updates!

It's a shame that the organisation prior to the wedding was frustrating, as Branxholm Park truly has the potential to be the greatest 5-star wedding venue. After our arrival, everything felt very fun and relaxed, and the 2-night package allowed us to settle in and explore without feeling rushed about. We made use of the hot tub and karaoke room the first night, slept well in the huge comfortable beds, and had a relaxed morning getting ready in the house without having to stress about travelling to a separate ceremony venue. The whole house-party vibe was perfect for a relaxed holiday experience without feeling stuffy or formal. Some areas could have done with a better clean and a bit of love, and one of the showers upstairs didn't seem to work, but this didn't spoil it for us.

The meal the night before the wedding was lovely; hearty burgers with chips and an incredible range of cakes. The vegan cakes were among the best we've ever tasted - the blueberry/banana and the jaffa cake were standouts! Our wedding cake was a vegan lemon and blueberry one, which tasted absolutely amazing but was a little disappointing visually - it didn't resemble the reference images we had sent, and had been covered in artificial flowers, which was honestly a little tacky.* The promised "cake sword" also did not appear - we were just handed a kitchen knife for our cake cutting photos - and we weren't warned that there was cardboard inside each tier (not between; inside) of the cake, which made it difficult to cut.

Breakfast and brunch were excellent, no shortage of bacon/sausage/egg/vegan rolls, jam-filled croissants, and other lovely snacks. The canapes were also lovely - a great selection including some fab Asian-fusion style bites which is apparently the chef's speciality - I wish we'd known this in advance, as it might have influenced our dinner choices. The meal on the wedding day was a little disappointing, especially the risotto, but we did take a chance by going off-menu, which was very kind of the team to accommodate. A guest particularly remarked on the high quality of the gluten-free bread rolls, and all allergies/dietary requirements were catered for. Guests were promised gluten-free gnocchi but were given pasta instead, which was still very tasty but just a bit of a shame.

*On that note - be aware that all of the florals provided as part of the venue package are artificial and re-used repeatedly. This was not an issue for us, and better than importing real flowers and the associated waste, but just worth mentioning as this isn't explicitly stated by the venue.

Our guests stayed in the flats in Hawick that are also owned by David - these had a couple of issues with cleanliness/storage space and confusing plumbing but on the whole were lovely and comfortable. One major flaw was that there is only one set of keys per flat - this is fine for the one-bed, but made it frustrating for the people in the five-bed as they were all arriving at different times.

The only other real snag was accessibility - we had a guest who uses a wheelchair, and were told that the chapel was accessible but it is actually up a steep gravel slope (not clear on the video tour) and does not have space for a wheelchair, meaning he had to sit outside for the ceremony. The only downstairs loo is also not big enough for disabled access, and the house and glasshouse both have a step at the entrance. We understand that it's an old house and as such wouldn't have been built with accessibility in mind, but just be aware!

Overall, if you love animals and are looking for a whimsical wedding getaway with endless entertainment and photo opportunities, Branxholm Park is the place for you! The package deal they offer is ideally suited to laid-back, go-with-the-flow couples who don't need fine control of every aspect of their day and are relaxed about the planning process and timeline.

We had the most magical wedding at Branxholm. The team at the venue made sure everything ran smoothly and went above and beyond on every aspect of the day. Arthur the puppy especially loved his special treatment. Our guests had a great day and said it was the best wedding they had ever attended.

It is a truly unique venue and would highly recommend it to everyone.

Our wedding at Branxholm Park in Hawick was nothing short of spectacular, thanks to the incredible team and the stunning venue itself. From the moment we arrived, we were treated to an experience that exceeded all our expectations, making our special day truly unforgettable.

Deb and David, our wedding coordinators, were phenomenal. Their expertise, attention to detail, and genuine care for our wedding were evident from our first meeting. They were instrumental in ensuring everything ran smoothly, allowing us to fully enjoy our day without any worries. Deb's thoughtful gesture of getting us food to feed the goats for our pictures was a delightful and memorable highlight, adding a unique touch to our celebration.

Jess, Tracy and the rest of the staff provided service that was nothing short of amazing. Jess, in particular, was always available to answer any questions and assist us throughout our three-day stay. Her warm and accommodating nature made us feel at ease, and she went above and beyond to ensure every aspect of our event was perfect.

The night before the wedding was incredibly relaxed, setting the tone for the rest of our stay. We all enjoyed exploring the beautiful grounds, taking a dip in the hot tub, using the karaoke room, and playing volleyball and football tennis. The relaxed atmosphere allowed us to unwind and enjoy quality time with our loved ones, making the lead-up to our big day even more special.

All our guests were captivated by the beauty of Branxholm Park. The venue's charm and elegance created the perfect backdrop for our wedding, and many guests commented on how stunning it was. The picturesque surroundings, coupled with the well-maintained and beautifully decorated spaces, made for an enchanting setting that will forever be etched in our memories.

The canap√©s served at our wedding were a standout feature, with numerous guests raving about their quality and taste. Each bite was a culinary delight, reflecting the high standards of Branxholm Park's catering. The attention to detail in the presentation and the exquisite flavours truly impressed everyone, adding to the overall excellence of our wedding experience. I know that the Bestman tried his best to eat as many unlimited canap√©s as he could and at one point have 5 finished risotto spoons in his hand.

One of the most memorable aspects of our wedding was the opportunity to interact with the goats during our photo session, thanks to Deb who brought out goat food to attract them over. This unique and personal touch made our day even more special and provided us with cherished memories and wonderful photos.

Branxholm Park is an exceptional wedding venue that combines breathtaking beauty with outstanding service. All of the staff played crucial roles in making our wedding day perfect, and we are incredibly grateful for their dedication and hard work. We highly recommend Branxholm Park to anyone seeking a magical and unforgettable wedding experience. The intimate venue was beautiful, had a very relaxed vibe, and served great food and extremely tasty cakes! Thank you to all at Branxholm Park for making our dream wedding a reality.

Two weeks ago we got married at this stunning venue! üòç
From start to finish they couldn't do enough for us.
All of our guests described the day as
‚ÄòMagical‚Äô ü•π and honestly it really did feel like that!
David, thank you from the Friday we arrived you were very good with us all and made sure we had everything and nothing was a problem to them!
Your staff are so lovely too, especially the lady who was doing the room cleans. Sorry i have forgot her name but she was so good with the children too.

I would 100% recommend getting a reception drinks singer and a dj for the evening!

Overall from start to finish the price / package was just perfect so thank you so so much xxi

Just arrived home after our wedding here at Branxholm Park. The venue was absolutely perfect, everything had been thought of. Everywhere you looked you‚Äôd find a stunning little area that made the place feel so whimsical. David & Debs are fantastic hosts, nothing was a problem and they were at hand not only on the lead up to the wedding but also throughout our stay to make sure everything went to plan. The wedding package is great and made everything feel so stress free. The staff were brilliant, so helpful and just fit into the day to make sure everything ticked along nicely. Hats off to the chef, the food was out of this world!!

We can‚Äôt recommend this place enough, a magical wedding venue!

Thank you again for everything!

My husband and I got married here just days ago.

We came a long way from London, and took a gamble having never seen the venue in person before. Let me tell you; as our minibus ambled round the corner and Branxholm Park came into view, we all gasped. It‚Äôs just stunning. Truly something out of a fairytale.

We were given the warmest of welcomes by the wonderful Tracey, who had also helped our other guests to their rooms. Actually, she was, along with too many other points to mention, a highlight of our wedding experience. Tracey couldn‚Äôt do too much for us; she was such an Angel. She looked after our party so well that she was a fond topic of conversation on the way home! We love you Tracey!

I then caught up with David, who ran through every aspect of the following day with me, ensuring that everything we wanted and needed was in place. Again, I need to shout out to him because he checked on me consistently throughout the day, and was a huge hit with the kids; taking them with him armed with carrots to see the horses, and generally being fantastic. If you‚Äôre nervous or full of emotions then you need someone steady and calm like David to see you through!

The chapel was adorned with florals of our colour choice, and was something out of a true fairytale. With twinkling fairy lights and gorgeous details!

Each of our rooms were designed with a different theme in mind and were so luxurious and stunning that we didn‚Äôt want to leave. No, really!

The grounds are huge, and there is so much to do; our groomsmen spent the wedding morning using the spa facilities whilst the kids fell in love with the goats and outdoor playground.

The head chef, Jamie, was a hilarious sweetheart who as a fellow south Londoner I loved bantering with! The food was sublime.

I think I could spend all day writing about all the wonderful things that made our day so special. But alas, word limits. If you‚Äôre thinking about getting married here. Just do it. These memories will last us a lifetime; our guests, too. Best wedding I‚Äôve ever been to and it was my own!

To David, Deb, Tracey, Jamie and ALL the wonderful staff (Jess, for holding my veil!!) we‚Äôd like to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for playing such a massive role in making our day the best ever. ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

When selecting a wedding venue, after doing our research we decided to visit Branxholm Park as it ticked all our boxes - it catered for a more intimate size of wedding, it was exclusive use, and it had on site accommodation. We thought it looked beautiful on the website - as Michael put "a bit like where the elves in Lord of the Rings" would dine".

When we visited, we knew very quickly that this was our perfect place, so much so that we never viewed any other venues! We could instantly envision ourselves an our guests celebrating here on our wedding weekend, staying in the beautiful rooms and chilling in the sauna. Michael's only question was - will there be dessert? However after sampling some of the delicious cakes that Deb made, we were more than satisfied that this was a yes.

When we arrived at the venue on the eve of our wedding, David was there to put our wedding nerves at ease. We were free to explore the venue, and to share all the rooms, features and animals with our families and friends. Our niece and nephew loved the mini cinema on the top floor, and were endlessly amused for the whole weekend. The Bring Your Own Booze option worked very well, with the groom party enjoying a few drinks then night before (until 3am!).

On the wedding day itself, myself and the bridal party opted for the oriental room to get ready in, though there were plenty of other options. Tracy looked after us, bringing coffees, breakfast, lunch and some fizz while we were getting ready.

The venue has a beautiful mini chapel which we got married in. As it was a gorgeous sunny day, our guests were able to make full use of the lovely grounds to enjoy a drink before and after the ceremony. Our photographers were delighted with so many options for stunning backdrops.

The wedding meal was fantastic. We enjoyed the (competitive) champagne fountain, and the dining room itself was beautiful. We added our own finishing touches to each table - favours and "wedding trump" cards - however they were already beautiful with nothing more needed.

One thing I would say is that you and your guests will never go hungry. The catering team did an amazing job on the meal itself, and kept us fed throughout the night with rolls, chips (according to several of our guests - the best chips they had ever eaten) and cake. They also catered to various allergies, intolerances and tastes.

The disco room worked very well. Our music connected easily to the speaker system, and we danced the night away. Our guests enjoyed playing barperson, and the drinks were flowing.
What I enjoyed most about the after party is that there was something for everyone - it was lovely to see our dad's playing a game of table tennis, and our friends singing karaoke with silly hats on. This is the perfect set up for extraverts and introverts alike!

Overall, I would recommend Branxholm Park if you are seeking a more intimate wedding with your closest family and friends. They managed to capture a house party vibe while adding a taste of luxury and a touch of magic. We could not have asked for a better day!

On Sunday 28th October 2018 I married my best friend at this amazing resort.

The events team made everything easy and listened with intent as we spoke about our ideas and dreams for our speacial day, absolutely nothing was too much trouble, the staff before and on the day were attentive and amazing, we could not have asked for anything else.
Thank you to Claire and her team. thank you to Bruce for guiding us through the whole ceremony and meal, thank you to the staff who served us all that day/night you will always hold a special place in our hearts

My husband(woohoo) and I had the most perfect day. The staff were delightful and so helpful. They really made the whole thing seamless. I would recommend Forbes to anyone whether it‚Äôs for a short stay or a wedding. Even just a meal! Absolutely fantastic, so many of our guests said it had been the best wedding they had been to.

Me and my husband got married at Forbes Of Kingennie in march 2017 . The venue was beautiful . The staff were lovely and friendly and did anything for you in order for the day to run smoothly . The lodges are gorgeous . And overall a brilliant venue .

My husband and I choose Forbes of kingennie because of the beautiful setting and the boat house,

Forbes of Kingennie have weddings down to a fine art. We didn't have t worry about anything on the day and everything went seamlessly. The staff were so friendly and we had a beautiful warm day to enjoy the grounds. There was a lovely mix of indoor and outdoor spaces to suit us.

Lovely venue. Lovely setting, Staff are so friendly and excellent. We had the wedding day of our dreams at Forbes of Kingennie. Simply wonderful and stunning throughout the whole weekend we stayed. Thanks again Kingennie team xxx
Fantastic views in such a peaceful location. Attentive staff. Stayed in the boathouse on our first night.... beautiful

This venue surpassed our expectations.
The staff overlooked all our needs, the staff as a team where supportive and helpful at all times.

The staff at the Leonardo deserve gold medals for their work! From beginning to end the service is impeccable. Whether answering my never ending (and some times silly) questions, helping me on the day of with my ceremony seat layout, the setting up of all my decorations. Bryony and John are superhero‚Äôs. I had a family member appear and disappear within 20 minutes and Bryony was so helpful at getting him a seat at a table which then had to be removed. Everything was absolutely perfect and the staff were so helpful! 100/10 would recommend

I had my wedding here on Saturday 29/3/25. It was quite a big wedding - 128 day guests with another 60 at night. I cannot fault Leonardo Murrayfield. I would not have changed a thing. Right from the first meeting with Tracey when booking the venue to the last drink from the wonderful staff on the day itself. They are prompt with any replies, professional, flexible with all the dietary requirements and what we wanted for menu. All the decorations and extra touches were 2nd to none. Bryony, Charlie and Luke on the day were fantastic. Kept everything running smoothly. I would 100% recommend this hotel for great value for money as well has having friendly, helpful staff and a beautiful meal which every guest enjoyed and commented that it was hot when served and everyone at the table served at the same time. I honestly can‚Äôt praise this hotel and staff enough for making everything just perfect!!

We had our wedding reception here after having our ceremony on a different date. We arranged a viewing with Tracey, she showed us around and helped us in vision what it would look like with our theme and everything else we had planned. Tracey also gave us a list of recommended vendors for things such as DJ, events companies and cake suppliers which made it so much simpler for us when it came to booking these especially when they already had experience of setting up in the venue as knew what would look great. Straight away we knew this was the ideal venue and booked our date there and then. The communication with Tracey in the months leading up to the reception was great then we had a final meeting to go over all the little details a couple weeks before. On the day of the staff were very attentive and helpful. They even took over helping me do the decorations as I was running behind. I went to get ready and when I came down I was amazed by what a great job they‚Äôd done and how beautiful the venue looked right down to all the small details. The night ran smoothly and our guests had a great night. The buffet selection was very generous and there was a great selection for welcome drinks for our guests.
Overall it was a great experience from the very beginning with Tracey to the end of the whole event. I would definitely recommend this venue.

The service we received from Tracy was outstanding. Everything was so straightforward and it was everything I wanted and asked for. We all had a fantastic time and I couldn‚Äôt have asked for anything more! I had total faith in Tracy and her team, and the whole day and night went so smooth. From our initial meeting with Tracey to Charlie helping us on the day nothing was too much bother. Tracey was super knowledgeable and approachable. We got married at Newton Hall last week and had the most perfect day! The team accommodated early access for ourselves and our guests which was organised without issues.

Thank you so so much to all of the staff at Newton Hall who went above and beyond to provide a day that far exceeded all of our expectations.

Our wedding coordinator Hannah was a dream to work alongside. We felt like the only couple she was working with and made the whole planning process feel easy (it wasn‚Äôt lol).

A huge shoutout to the wonderful staff who helped us in planning the day (a special thank you to Hannah), as well as the team who organised and ran the wedding day itself.

What can I say apart from wow. This venue was completely perfect and made our day incredible. Couldn't recommend Logie Country House enough. It has everything you need for an amazing, chilled out wedding weekend. The owners and wedding coordinators are super responsive and helpful. I‚Äôm not sure I can even begin to put into words how amazing our weekend - and our wedding day - was. Logie truly felt like home to us, our friends and family. The attention to detail was incredible. It got to a point where I knew I didn‚Äôt need to stress about organising or buying certain things, because I knew it would have been thought of by you guys. Everything went so smoothly on the wedding day, and that‚Äôs down to Lila and her hard work - so from the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

Having the opportunity to bring our family and friends together was so special. We could not have done that without you, Stef, and Tim, and all the work you‚Äôve done to make Logie the venue it is. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

I‚Äôm sure some people get married and their venue is simply somewhere to host their day, and their memories are more focused on their guests and each other‚Ä¶but for us Logie was as important and memorable as our guests, each other and everything else. Logie is an absolutely stunning venue and made the perfect setting for our daughter‚Äôs special day. The management (Stef & Tim) and staff are all first class to deal with and had the house and ballroom immaculately prepped for our arrival, to set such a relaxing and comfortable environment for us all to enjoy for the whole weekend.

Swimming pool, hot tubs etc) for the whole weekend allowed our stay over guests to relax and enjoy the surroundings in an informal environment that‚Äôs so easy to enjoy - as far as wedding venues go, this one is definitely right up there with the very best.

From trip advisor

From trip advisor

My daughter and now son-in-law held their wedding ceremony & reception at Logie House in April 2019. Logie House is a fully restored Scottish mansion house with very modern facilities (indoor swimming pool, hot tubs, kitchens & bathrooms, cinema/games room) with around 15 bedrooms, set in spacious grounds with fantastic views of the surrounding hills. It is a fantastic and very unique venue for a wedding, unlike the usual ‚Äòproduction line‚Äô hotel based weddings.

We had the full use of the house for 3 days (on a self-catering basis) and the large well equipped separate function room for the wedding day. What is unique about the Logie experience is that with 15 bedrooms, multiple reception rooms and a 3 day stay, both sides of the family & friends were able to get to know each other really well - something that we all valued and is usually missing in the typical 1 day wedding.

Logie Country House ‚Äì you won‚Äôt regret it.

Logie was the second venue we visited after getting engaged and we knew instantly that this was where we wanted to get married. The house has 13 bedrooms so we were able to have our family and friends stay with us from Friday through to Monday and allow us time to extend the celebrations and really get the most out of our wedding buzz.

It has a lot of amenities to keep everyone busy - swimming pool, TV/games room and 2 hot tubs (which were a Godsend with 12 kids to entertain!) and several 'living rooms'. It's got it's own island and secret tree house too!
Stef and Tim are lovely hosts who are accommodating to each guest's needs. It is such a big property to manage but nothing was an issue for them. They made us feel so welcome and ensured there was always someone available to help if we needed.

We had full use of the property for the weekend so could choose whether to get married outside in the courtyard, in the house or in the ballroom. Its very flexible to let you have exactly the day you want. We were lucky to have a sunny autumn day so we wandered all over the property for our photos and the fall colours were just stunning.

Gillian, the Events Manager was brilliant. She showed us round the place a few times to get us acquainted with it all and kept the whole day running smoothly. Thank you Gillian for keeping us right!

Review from trip advisor ...

These will forever remain the greatest and most magical 3 days of my life. Duns Castle is an incredible venue for a wedding. 27 of our closest family and friends travelled from Canada and everyone was blown away from their very first view of the castle. Mr & Mrs. Hay make sure that everything goes off without a hitch. They truly care about the castle and all of their guests that attend. The staff on site is also wonderful. The breakfast, bar service (they stocked the bar with whatever we wished), grounds (especially in June, the flowers on the grounds are incredible), cottages (all within walking distance and have all the necessities for a comfortable stay) and rooms (all decorated beautifully) are all impeccable. We flew our closest friends and family in from the U.S. and stayed at Duns Castle for a week with the wedding ceremony at the tail end of our stay. It was a fantastic adventure to bond our families together and show them everything there is to love about Scotland. My wife and I attended the University of Edinburgh for our MS degrees and fell in love with Scotland with all its serene castles and picturesque landscapes. Knowing we wanted to marry in Scotland we took several years to plan our perfect wedding at the most beautiful castle we could find. Duns was superb in every way providing excellent accommodation, handling all our requests and suggesting various services to help our wedding and entire stay to be magical.

I recently got married at Duns Castle and had a perfect wedding and a beautiful time. I searched for awhile to find the right spot, because I wanted an exclusive location that wasn't too hard to get to, had some history, and would accommodate my crazy family and friends. And Duns is perfect!!! It is even more stunning than the photos in person, if you can believe it, and the d√©cor is simply gorgeous. You really feel as if you're staying in a historic castle and everything is beautifully maintained. We rented out the castle for a Friday/Saturday night, booked all the cottages, and had some people stay at the inn at Duns. Friday night was Kilt & Casino night in the drawing room, the company that came to the castle did an amazing job. To do dinner easily, we picked up sandwiches and pastries from the bakery in town. I also used the local florist Scentiments and I cannot recommend them enough.. On the big day, we did skeet shooting with Stuart Elworthy. We got married in the drawing room by the Scottish Registrar, and Aline perfectly arranged the room so my mother could play the grand piano as my entrance. We had Regis Catering do our dinner and I was told my multiple people it was the best catered meal they've had at a wedding. Lorraine Ross, our photographer, got some beautiful shots of us atthe lake. I had a 2 person band setup outside the dining room next to the bar and Aline arranged speakers outside for everyone to enjoy. Alot of detail, but I arranged everything by email and phone and it went perfectly. Long story short, if you want to have a beautiful wedding in a Scottish Castle, I very much recommend this venue.

Perfect Wedding! The most beautiful setting you could imagine for your big day. We had to plan it long distance and Jonathan and Natalie were the best people to do so. They've organised everything for us, so we didn't have to worry about small things. They were very involved and helpful all the way through, even on our big day.

We had a small party for 50 people and it was just perfect. All of our guests stayed with us in a Castle and cottages on the grounds. Jonathan helped us to organise all the activities for the day before, like archery and croquet.

And as a surprise we were offered to plant our tree on the day. Which we did. And it was such a nice touch.

Duns Castle is not just beautiful, but truly unique experience. We can't wait to go back there to celebrate our anniversary as it is a part of our family now, not just a remarkable venue.

We had an unbelievable wedding weekend/life experience at Duns Castle in early June.

Catering and the bar at the castle was perfect, breakfast each morning was delicious and thoughtful, and everyone continuously told me how at home they felt and how much they loved the rooms and common areas ‚Äì Alick and Aline are truly amazing hosts, treat everyone with such kindness and maintain the property beautifully.
The ceremony was amazing ‚Äì we had it in the Drawing Room; the local florist added to an already great ambiance. The piper Duns Castle recommended was excellent and the downstairs dance room was the perfect venue for dancing after dinner and fireworks.
We hope to be back at Duns Castle often to relive the magic! Thank you Alick, Aline and everyone at Duns Castle ‚Äì you are amazing!

We got married at Kippilaw House and had the best time ever. Rachel was the best, she was super helpful the whole time and made us feel very comfortable. We didn‚Äôt feel any pressure to do anything we didn‚Äôt want to as we skipped a lot of traditional things that didn‚Äôt match with who we are.

From our initial meeting at the venue to waving goodbye the day after our wedding I cannot fault Marshal Meadows Manor. Our wedding at Marshall Meadows Manor House was everything we could have wished for. I highly recommend this beautiful Manor House , working in the wedding industry I visit many venues in Scotland and we choose to hop the border to spend our special day here.

I was just married here in June and I cannot say enough good things about this venue or the people who truly make it shine. Over your stay here no matter how short you will immediately feel like you are a part of the family. David and Deb are so wonderfully kind, incredibly helpful, personable, and outstanding at what they do. We planned this wedding from across the pond and I didn't have to worry once about food (which was one of the best meals I had while abroad), any of the ceremony or reception sites or flowers, really they take care of so much for you it makes the day so smooth and easy! Again I cannot say enough good things about David and the staff at Branxholm no one went hungry and certainly not thirsty the whole weekend. All of this and the fact that there are horses, baby chicks, goats, incredible accommodations, and literally SO MUCH more makes Branxholm Park the PERFECT wedding venue. I booked site unseen, it even rained and I regret nothing.
Fantastic time at Darren & Eilidh Leslie wedding *, beautiful venue,lovely food and great staff*. Thanks for letting oscar feed the horses

Brothers wedding so my son and I stayed the weekend along with other family members. Cannot recommend this place enough. Food was brilliant, the rooms were brilliant. Staff were so friendly, one of them even let my wee boy feed the horses on the Saturday morning. He absolutely loved it. If you are looking for a place for a wedding then this is the place

We got married at Branxholm Park in September 2024. The venue is beautiful; a quirky, well-curated collection of indoor and outdoor spaces, ensuring nobody could ever get bored. The animals are a gorgeous inclusion - the goats and horses are so friendly, and there's a wonderfully affectionate 3-legged cat called Cookie who was the real star of our day!

We booked the venue unseen - just based on the website and video tours - as we live in South Wales so couldn't nip up to an open day. This definitely contributed to my anxiety leading up to the day, but David & Debbie assured us that lots of people book without visiting, and the house and grounds really did exceed expectations. We did gasp as we drove up the road and saw it for the first time. We were lucky to have gorgeous sunny weather and the most amazing group of guests and vendors, so despite anxieties and small oversights, it really was a perfect wedding.

The staff at the house were fantastic, making us feel so incredibly welcome from the moment we arrived. Nothing was too much trouble. A special mention to Becky and Tracey, who were just fabulous friendly faces and above-and-beyond helpful.

I would have to say, though, that the wedding would have been much easier if we'd been able to speak to Becky (the on-the-day coordinator) in advance. It would also have been nice to receive some sort of welcome pack or guide to wedding planning. All the planning is done through emails with Debbie (the owner) who was a little difficult to talk to - slow or non-existent replies, confusing typos, lack of detail, and would not provide things like a seating plan despite being asked repeatedly. Maybe she's just very relaxed because they have a template for wedding days, but as an anxious couple we could have done with better communication and some more support with finalising details of our day. Several things that Debbie agreed/assured us would happen were not communicated to Becky and the house staff - they immediately sorted things out after our arrival and a quick chat, but it was unfair that they weren't warned about updates!

It's a shame that the organisation prior to the wedding was frustrating, as Branxholm Park truly has the potential to be the greatest 5-star wedding venue. After our arrival, everything felt very fun and relaxed, and the 2-night package allowed us to settle in and explore without feeling rushed about. We made use of the hot tub and karaoke room the first night, slept well in the huge comfortable beds, and had a relaxed morning getting ready in the house without having to stress about travelling to a separate ceremony venue. The whole house-party vibe was perfect for a relaxed holiday experience without feeling stuffy or formal. Some areas could have done with a better clean and a bit of love, and one of the showers upstairs didn't seem to work, but this didn't spoil it for us.

The meal the night before the wedding was lovely; hearty burgers with chips and an incredible range of cakes. The vegan cakes were among the best we've ever tasted - the blueberry/banana and the jaffa cake were standouts! Our wedding cake was a vegan lemon and blueberry one, which tasted absolutely amazing but was a little disappointing visually - it didn't resemble the reference images we had sent, and had been covered in artificial flowers, which was honestly a little tacky.* The promised "cake sword" also did not appear - we were just handed a kitchen knife for our cake cutting photos - and we weren't warned that there was cardboard inside each tier (not between; inside) of the cake, which made it difficult to cut.

Breakfast and brunch were excellent, no shortage of bacon/sausage/egg/vegan rolls, jam-filled croissants, and other lovely snacks. The canapes were also lovely - a great selection including some fab Asian-fusion style bites which is apparently the chef's speciality - I wish we'd known this in advance, as it might have influenced our dinner choices. The meal on the wedding day was a little disappointing, especially the risotto, but we did take a chance by going off-menu, which was very kind of the team to accommodate. A guest particularly remarked on the high quality of the gluten-free bread rolls, and all allergies/dietary requirements were catered for. Guests were promised gluten-free gnocchi but were given pasta instead, which was still very tasty but just a bit of a shame.

*On that note - be aware that all of the florals provided as part of the venue package are artificial and re-used repeatedly. This was not an issue for us, and better than importing real flowers and the associated waste, but just worth mentioning as this isn't explicitly stated by the venue.

Our guests stayed in the flats in Hawick that are also owned by David - these had a couple of issues with cleanliness/storage space and confusing plumbing but on the whole were lovely and comfortable. One major flaw was that there is only one set of keys per flat - this is fine for the one-bed, but made it frustrating for the people in the five-bed as they were all arriving at different times.

The only other real snag was accessibility - we had a guest who uses a wheelchair, and were told that the chapel was accessible but it is actually up a steep gravel slope (not clear on the video tour) and does not have space for a wheelchair, meaning he had to sit outside for the ceremony. The only downstairs loo is also not big enough for disabled access, and the house and glasshouse both have a step at the entrance. We understand that it's an old house and as such wouldn't have been built with accessibility in mind, but just be aware!

Overall, if you love animals and are looking for a whimsical wedding getaway with endless entertainment and photo opportunities, Branxholm Park is the place for you! The package deal they offer is ideally suited to laid-back, go-with-the-flow couples who don't need fine control of every aspect of their day and are relaxed about the planning process and timeline.

We had the most magical wedding at Branxholm. The team at the venue made sure everything ran smoothly and went above and beyond on every aspect of the day. Arthur the puppy especially loved his special treatment. Our guests had a great day and said it was the best wedding they had ever attended.

It is a truly unique venue and would highly recommend it to everyone.

Our wedding at Branxholm Park in Hawick was nothing short of spectacular, thanks to the incredible team and the stunning venue itself. From the moment we arrived, we were treated to an experience that exceeded all our expectations, making our special day truly unforgettable.

Deb and David, our wedding coordinators, were phenomenal. Their expertise, attention to detail, and genuine care for our wedding were evident from our first meeting. They were instrumental in ensuring everything ran smoothly, allowing us to fully enjoy our day without any worries. Deb's thoughtful gesture of getting us food to feed the goats for our pictures was a delightful and memorable highlight, adding a unique touch to our celebration.

Jess, Tracy and the rest of the staff provided service that was nothing short of amazing. Jess, in particular, was always available to answer any questions and assist us throughout our three-day stay. Her warm and accommodating nature made us feel at ease, and she went above and beyond to ensure every aspect of our event was perfect.

The night before the wedding was incredibly relaxed, setting the tone for the rest of our stay. We all enjoyed exploring the beautiful grounds, taking a dip in the hot tub, using the karaoke room, and playing volleyball and football tennis. The relaxed atmosphere allowed us to unwind and enjoy quality time with our loved ones, making the lead-up to our big day even more special.

All our guests were captivated by the beauty of Branxholm Park. The venue's charm and elegance created the perfect backdrop for our wedding, and many guests commented on how stunning it was. The picturesque surroundings, coupled with the well-maintained and beautifully decorated spaces, made for an enchanting setting that will forever be etched in our memories.

The canap√©s served at our wedding were a standout feature, with numerous guests raving about their quality and taste. Each bite was a culinary delight, reflecting the high standards of Branxholm Park's catering. The attention to detail in the presentation and the exquisite flavours truly impressed everyone, adding to the overall excellence of our wedding experience. I know that the Bestman tried his best to eat as many unlimited canap√©s as he could and at one point have 5 finished risotto spoons in his hand.

One of the most memorable aspects of our wedding was the opportunity to interact with the goats during our photo session, thanks to Deb who brought out goat food to attract them over. This unique and personal touch made our day even more special and provided us with cherished memories and wonderful photos.

Branxholm Park is an exceptional wedding venue that combines breathtaking beauty with outstanding service. All of the staff played crucial roles in making our wedding day perfect, and we are incredibly grateful for their dedication and hard work. We highly recommend Branxholm Park to anyone seeking a magical and unforgettable wedding experience. The intimate venue was beautiful, had a very relaxed vibe, and served great food and extremely tasty cakes! Thank you to all at Branxholm Park for making our dream wedding a reality.

Two weeks ago we got married at this stunning venue! üòç
From start to finish they couldn't do enough for us.
All of our guests described the day as
‚ÄòMagical‚Äô ü•π and honestly it really did feel like that!
David, thank you from the Friday we arrived you were very good with us all and made sure we had everything and nothing was a problem to them!
Your staff are so lovely too, especially the lady who was doing the room cleans. Sorry i have forgot her name but she was so good with the children too.

I would 100% recommend getting a reception drinks singer and a dj for the evening!

Overall from start to finish the price / package was just perfect so thank you so so much xxi

Just arrived home after our wedding here at Branxholm Park. The venue was absolutely perfect, everything had been thought of. Everywhere you looked you‚Äôd find a stunning little area that made the place feel so whimsical. David & Debs are fantastic hosts, nothing was a problem and they were at hand not only on the lead up to the wedding but also throughout our stay to make sure everything went to plan. The wedding package is great and made everything feel so stress free. The staff were brilliant, so helpful and just fit into the day to make sure everything ticked along nicely. Hats off to the chef, the food was out of this world!!

We can‚Äôt recommend this place enough, a magical wedding venue!

Thank you again for everything!

My husband and I got married here just days ago.

We came a long way from London, and took a gamble having never seen the venue in person before. Let me tell you; as our minibus ambled round the corner and Branxholm Park came into view, we all gasped. It‚Äôs just stunning. Truly something out of a fairytale.

We were given the warmest of welcomes by the wonderful Tracey, who had also helped our other guests to their rooms. Actually, she was, along with too many other points to mention, a highlight of our wedding experience. Tracey couldn‚Äôt do too much for us; she was such an Angel. She looked after our party so well that she was a fond topic of conversation on the way home! We love you Tracey!

I then caught up with David, who ran through every aspect of the following day with me, ensuring that everything we wanted and needed was in place. Again, I need to shout out to him because he checked on me consistently throughout the day, and was a huge hit with the kids; taking them with him armed with carrots to see the horses, and generally being fantastic. If you‚Äôre nervous or full of emotions then you need someone steady and calm like David to see you through!

The chapel was adorned with florals of our colour choice, and was something out of a true fairytale. With twinkling fairy lights and gorgeous details!

Each of our rooms were designed with a different theme in mind and were so luxurious and stunning that we didn‚Äôt want to leave. No, really!

The grounds are huge, and there is so much to do; our groomsmen spent the wedding morning using the spa facilities whilst the kids fell in love with the goats and outdoor playground.

The head chef, Jamie, was a hilarious sweetheart who as a fellow south Londoner I loved bantering with! The food was sublime.

I think I could spend all day writing about all the wonderful things that made our day so special. But alas, word limits. If you‚Äôre thinking about getting married here. Just do it. These memories will last us a lifetime; our guests, too. Best wedding I‚Äôve ever been to and it was my own!

To David, Deb, Tracey, Jamie and ALL the wonderful staff (Jess, for holding my veil!!) we‚Äôd like to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for playing such a massive role in making our day the best ever. ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

When selecting a wedding venue, after doing our research we decided to visit Branxholm Park as it ticked all our boxes - it catered for a more intimate size of wedding, it was exclusive use, and it had on site accommodation. We thought it looked beautiful on the website - as Michael put "a bit like where the elves in Lord of the Rings" would dine".

When we visited, we knew very quickly that this was our perfect place, so much so that we never viewed any other venues! We could instantly envision ourselves an our guests celebrating here on our wedding weekend, staying in the beautiful rooms and chilling in the sauna. Michael's only question was - will there be dessert? However after sampling some of the delicious cakes that Deb made, we were more than satisfied that this was a yes.

When we arrived at the venue on the eve of our wedding, David was there to put our wedding nerves at ease. We were free to explore the venue, and to share all the rooms, features and animals with our families and friends. Our niece and nephew loved the mini cinema on the top floor, and were endlessly amused for the whole weekend. The Bring Your Own Booze option worked very well, with the groom party enjoying a few drinks then night before (until 3am!).

On the wedding day itself, myself and the bridal party opted for the oriental room to get ready in, though there were plenty of other options. Tracy looked after us, bringing coffees, breakfast, lunch and some fizz while we were getting ready.

The venue has a beautiful mini chapel which we got married in. As it was a gorgeous sunny day, our guests were able to make full use of the lovely grounds to enjoy a drink before and after the ceremony. Our photographers were delighted with so many options for stunning backdrops.

The wedding meal was fantastic. We enjoyed the (competitive) champagne fountain, and the dining room itself was beautiful. We added our own finishing touches to each table - favours and "wedding trump" cards - however they were already beautiful with nothing more needed.

One thing I would say is that you and your guests will never go hungry. The catering team did an amazing job on the meal itself, and kept us fed throughout the night with rolls, chips (according to several of our guests - the best chips they had ever eaten) and cake. They also catered to various allergies, intolerances and tastes.

The disco room worked very well. Our music connected easily to the speaker system, and we danced the night away. Our guests enjoyed playing barperson, and the drinks were flowing.
What I enjoyed most about the after party is that there was something for everyone - it was lovely to see our dad's playing a game of table tennis, and our friends singing karaoke with silly hats on. This is the perfect set up for extraverts and introverts alike!

Overall, I would recommend Branxholm Park if you are seeking a more intimate wedding with your closest family and friends. They managed to capture a house party vibe while adding a taste of luxury and a touch of magic. We could not have asked for a better day!

On Sunday 28th October 2018 I married my best friend at this amazing resort.
From the moment we walked in to Forbes of Kingennie Country Resort we knew this was the place we wanted to make our commitment to each other.

From trip advisor

From trip advisor

My daughter and now son-in-law held their wedding ceremony & reception at Logie House in April 2019. Logie House is a fully restored Scottish mansion house with very modern facilities (indoor swimming pool, hot tubs, kitchens & bathrooms, cinema/games room) with around 15 bedrooms, set in spacious grounds with fantastic views of the surrounding hills. It is a fantastic and very unique venue for a wedding, unlike the usual ‚Äòproduction line‚Äô hotel based weddings.

We had the full use of the house for 3 days (on a self-catering basis) and the large well equipped separate function room for the wedding day. What is unique about the Logie experience is that with 15 bedrooms, multiple reception rooms and a 3 day stay, both sides of the family & friends were able to get to know each other really well - something that we all valued and is usually missing in the typical 1 day wedding.

Logie Country House ‚Äì you won‚Äôt regret it.

Logie was the second venue we visited after getting engaged and we knew instantly that this was where we wanted to get married. The house has 13 bedrooms so we were able to have our family and friends stay with us from Friday through to Monday and allow us time to extend the celebrations and really get the most out of our wedding buzz.

It has a lot of amenities to keep everyone busy - swimming pool, TV/games room and 2 hot tubs (which were a Godsend with 12 kids to entertain!) and several 'living rooms'. It's got it's own island and secret tree house too!
Stef and Tim are lovely hosts who are accommodating to each guest's needs. It is such a big property to manage but nothing was an issue for them. They made us feel so welcome and ensured there was always someone available to help if we needed.

We had full use of the property for the weekend so could choose whether to get married outside in the courtyard, in the house or in the ballroom. Its very flexible to let you have exactly the day you want. We were lucky to have a sunny autumn day so we wandered all over the property for our photos and the fall colours were just stunning.

Gillian, the Events Manager was brilliant. She showed us round the place a few times to get us acquainted with it all and kept the whole day running smoothly. Thank you Gillian for keeping us right!

Review from trip advisor ...

Hi Annie,


Both myself and Nav would like to express a big thank you to you and your team at Hudson's. We have had so many messages saying how amazing the food was. We didn't make it easy for you with the diverse food types, but you definitely pulled it off. Everything we asked for you made fantastically without no fuss. The Indian food especially was great, and this feedback came from the Indian guests, some of them with over 50 years of experience in cooking traditional Indian food, which goes to show how amazing a chef you are!

Hi Gillian,

Now the dust has settled and reality has kicked in, especially as I sit here at work, thinking about the weekend with a smile. Both Nav and I would just like to express our gratitude for everything you did for us to make the last few days the most magical weekend of our lives. It really was amazing from the Friday morning when we arrived until we left on Monday, and a huge part of making it run so smoothly was you and your team (as well as Stef and Tim).

We have had so many messages saying how amazing everything was, including the decor, food, organisation, and most notably the amazing Logie County House and its setting! It took many peoples breath away, including ours!

We will always look back with such fond memories, and hopefully, we will get another opportunity to visit the house again in the years to come.

So once again, thank you all and take care.

Myself & my husband booked this venue after our previous venue cancelled on us. from the beginning the team at Achnagairn were so supportive and helpful. I cannot recommend Achnagairn highly enough as a wedding venue.

These will forever remain the greatest and most magical 3 days of my life. Duns Castle is an incredible venue for a wedding. 27 of our closest family and friends travelled from Canada and everyone was blown away from their very first view of the castle. Mr & Mrs. Hay make sure that everything goes off without a hitch. They truly care about the castle and all of their guests that attend. The staff on site is also wonderful. The breakfast, bar service (they stocked the bar with whatever we wished), grounds (especially in June, the flowers on the grounds are incredible), cottages (all within walking distance and have all the necessities for a comfortable stay) and rooms (all decorated beautifully) are all impeccable. They were not opposed to any of our requests and did their absolute best to accommodate us and our wishes. I would recommend Duns Castle to anyone who wishes to get married in Scotland. We cannot wait to visit again!

We flew our closest friends and family in from the U.S. and stayed at Duns Castle for a week with the wedding ceremony at the tail end of our stay. It was a fantastic adventure to bond our families together and show them everything there is to love about Scotland. My wife and I attended the University of Edinburgh for our MS degrees and fell in love with Scotland with all its serene castles and picturesque landscapes. Knowing we wanted to marry in Scotland we took several years to plan our perfect wedding at the most beautiful castle we could find. Duns was superb in every way providing excellent accommodation, handling all our requests and suggesting various services to help our wedding and entire stay to be magical.

I recently got married at Duns Castle and had a perfect wedding and a beautiful time. I searched for awhile to find the right spot, because I wanted an exclusive location that wasn't too hard to get to, had some history, and would accommodate my crazy family and friends. And Duns is perfect!!! It is even more stunning than the photos in person, if you can believe it, and the d√©cor is simply gorgeous. You really feel as if you're staying in a historic castle and everything is beautifully maintained. We rented out the castle for a Friday/Saturday night, booked all the cottages, and had some people stay at the inn at Duns. Friday night was Kilt & Casino night in the drawing room, the company that came to the castle did an amazing job. To do dinner easily, we picked up sandwiches and pastries from the bakery in town. I also used the local florist Scentiments and I cannot recommend them enough.. On the big day, we did skeet shooting with Stuart Elworthy. We got married in the drawing room by the Scottish Registrar, and Aline perfectly arranged the room so my mother could play the grand piano as my entrance. We had Regis Catering do our dinner and I was told my multiple people it was the best catered meal they've had at a wedding. Lorraine Ross, our photographer, got some beautiful shots of us atthe lake. I had a 2 person band setup outside the dining room next to the bar and Aline arranged speakers outside for everyone to enjoy. Alot of detail, but I arranged everything by email and phone and it went perfectly. Long story short, if you want to have a beautiful wedding in a Scottish Castle, I very much recommend this venue.

Perfect Wedding! The most beautiful setting you could imagine for your big day. We had to plan it long distance and Jonathan and Natalie were the best people to do so. They've organised everything for us, so we didn't have to worry about small things. They were very involved and helpful all the way through, even on our big day.

We had a small party for 50 people and it was just perfect. All of our guests stayed with us in a Castle and cottages on the grounds. Jonathan helped us to organise all the activities for the day before, like archery and croquet.

And as a surprise we were offered to plant our tree on the day. Which we did. And it was such a nice touch.

Duns Castle is not just beautiful, but truly unique experience. We can't wait to go back there to celebrate our anniversary as it is a part of our family now, not just a remarkable venue.

We had an unbelievable wedding weekend/life experience at Duns Castle in early June.
Alick and Aline and the entire staff led by Natalie, Jonathan and Robert, went above and beyond in creating truly once-in-a-lifetime moments for us throughout our 4 night stay. We did an exclusive use stay with the cottages as well, and they were perfect. Activities throughout the weekend were well-organized with the help of Duns Castle; including great recommendations on restaurants, fun things to do in the area and extra lodgings in town and the surroundings. Catering and the bar at the castle was perfect, breakfast each morning was delicious and thoughtful, and everyone continuously told me how at home they felt and how much they loved the rooms and common areas ‚Äì Alick and Aline are truly amazing hosts, treat everyone with such kindness and maintain the property beautifully.
The ceremony was amazing ‚Äì we had it in the Drawing Room; the local florist added to an already great ambiance. The piper Duns Castle recommended was excellent and the downstairs dance room was the perfect venue for dancing after dinner and fireworks.
We hope to be back at Duns Castle often to relive the magic! Thank you Alick, Aline and everyone at Duns Castle ‚Äì you are amazing!

We had our wedding at this beautiful Castle and all I can say is wow. We have just received our wedding pictures back and the memories we have of this location for the rest of our lives is just amazing. Lots of great places to walk and see with lots of character. So quiet. We felt like royalty. All our guests are still talking about how amazing this place is with its beautiful grounds, driving up to the Castle it just takes your breath away.

My husband and I got married at Duns Castle in July 2016. Everything was absolutely perfect. You cannot beat this setting for your special day. This place, the history, and the people of Duns Castle exceeded my expectations. The beauty of this castle took my breath away when I first saw it. My daughter recently was married here. For us, it was a destination wedding that was made perfect. The hospitality of the Hay family is absolutely the best. Thanks to Citation, we had the perfect wedding day from start to finish. You helped create memories for us which will last a lifetime and every time we walk past, we will be reminded of how we celebrated the most important day of our lives in one of Glasgow‚Äôs most iconic and memorable venues.

Our wedding at Citation was perfect, we couldn‚Äôt have asked for a more relaxed day! Hannah, Aidan and Casey and the rest of the staff on the day did such a fantastic job in making sure everything ran smoothly, if anything went wrong then we had no idea!
We had so many comments from guests about how lovely the venue was, the delicious meal and how efficient everything ran. Pauline and Hannah put our minds at ease from the very first meeting, the planning stage was not really stressful at all for us as they had everything covered and made sure no small detail was forgotten, even thinking of things that would never have crossed our minds.
Thanks again to everyone at Citation, we can‚Äôt recommend them highly enough!

Had an amazing time having our wedding at Citation. The staff were very lovely and throughout the process were great at answering our questions. We wanted to lose some of the traditional wedding elements and add in a few bits of our own, which the venue accommodated brilliantly, even though some venues won‚Äôt.

The food was great and all dietary requirements were easily catered for

Our guests even commented on how friendly, helpful and pleasant the staff were so it was great that they noticed it too and not just us as the people staff were working most directly with. They definitely went above and beyond and we are super grateful!

We can‚Äôt thank Louize and the team at Citation enough for our incredible wedding reception party in August. We had the best night ever in this beautiful venue and felt so well looked after. Everything was so well organised we didn‚Äôt have to worry about a thing. We got so many compliments about the venue, it was just perfect! If your looking for a gorgeous city venue this is it!

Citation was outstanding.
The staff, food and venue were amazing Highly recommend

The venue is absolutely stunning, The city centre location is perfect for friends and family traveling distances and also perfect for more quirky unique wedding photos.

The team were amazing at ensuring the day went smoothly and the quality of everything was just exceptional.

Louize was fantastic at planning the entire day we cannot thank everyone enough for making our day so special.

Amazing day organised by an incredible team! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a stunning venue and a brilliant package. No issues on the day and everything ran so smoothly with the help of Louize and her team. Great price for everything that you get. We had the best day and can‚Äôt thank them all enough for their attention to detail and constant reassurance throughout the planning stages.

We married at Citation on August 19th this year and were over the moon with our day and night. From the start Louize was amazing, so professional and helpful. Citation is a beautiful venue and on the day Natalie and me and all of our guests were blown away. We had our dream wedding and cannot thank Louize and all the team for making the occasion unforgettable - thank you guys !

We had our day at Citation on the 1st of August 2022 having previously switched venue from 29 Glasgow. Louize and the team are an absolute credit to Citation, Louize in particular is amazing, so accommodating, friendly and most importantly so knowledgeable and competent she really takes the pressure off and allows the couple to enjoy the planning of their day as well as the day itself. Citation is absolutely breath-taking, such a beautiful venue in the middle of Glasgow I cannot think of a single other place that could compare. The entire day of my wedding I had guests talking about how beautiful the venue was and how wonderful the staff were. The master of ceremonies was a gentleman and instantly put an anxious bride at ease! I can never thank you all enough, you absolutely gave me the day I have always dreamt of and with a team that made us feel first class all day

Citation were fantastic from start to finish. No query was too small, no question too silly. Louize was always approachable and professional and ensured the full day tan like clockwork. The venue is stunning and every guest commented on its unique vibe and lovely atmosphere. I would not change a thing about our day!
